column5: Nice trucks Z! I'd love to get into those... brings back memories circa 1978ish when I got a 4wd Jeep from Radio Shack. Pretty good rig for back in the day. I know if I got one I'd go nuts with it... did that with the slot cars about 15 yrs ago. By the way, who builds the models on the wall for you, Chip Foose? Some sweet customs there. -Brian
Brian alot of the diecast are by Jada toys there called Dub City Ole school etc,and thanks I love these trucks,I can thrash these instead of my full size daily driver when the urge comes on lol
Brian heres a few pics of the diecast ,I d like to start a construction set either JD or Cat but that will come with time and money

2Tone, here's a little 4" diecast fire truck I played with as a kid back in the early 50's  I'd forgotten all about it many moons ago,  but then found it again about 40 years later under my parents front porch when I was doing some renovations for them. It was in rough shape after laying in the cold dirt for 40 odd years, but I cleaned it up and gave it some fresh paint and it now sits warm & dry in a curio cabinet with a bunch of other collectibles I have.  Fun memories

Lew thats awesome ,I wish I had some of my toys from my childhood,my parents said I either totaly destroyed them or tore it apart to see what made it tick then lost interest or parts lol ,nice find prob ton of memories as well
trucks cars copters if ya run em post it
I like my RCs with a Moonpie (banana)!!!
quite possibly the best Cola ever made
I preferred the Pop Machine soda as a kid... buy the syrup (s) carbonate the water and mix... the possibilities were endless!!  G.
I've had an RC heli for a year now. This one is really challenging and my first bird, so I still have allot to learn.
Cast away how hard is that to handle thats my next RC

I recently bought myself a Dragonfly heli.  Good thing I started with an electric bird, because if I had started off with a gas bird it would have been a costly crash   .  I wish my Jeep had remote control, it would be helpful when launching the boat on my own.  I will start planning that concept.  Should make me rich ... like Hasselhoff.
Have a couple older RC 10s that the kids and I race around the ball diamond behind the house. These relics are incredibly durable and we have a blast with them!  :-)

2 tone, this bird is difficult to learn on as it is a stunt heli that can fly upside down. I read allot of RC boards first and most people were sorry that they bought a basic heli first because they mastered it so quickly that they got bored with it and moved up. It took me a month the learn to get if off the ground without crashing it.  Read more here: RC
I have an RC10GT and a Jato right now... Thinking about picking up a burshless Rustler in the next little while...
Nice I sold my RC10GT on ebay last winter, got a new Emaxx Monday,Love it

Used to race I.M.P.B.A and ran cars for awhile I used to fly out of araura flying club, for boats I ran mainly riggers and some vee's, i am playing with a dragonfly v.4 now with not much luck lol I need a new tail boom now as for planes my fave was the scamp but I have flown quite a few trainers to mid.

If anyone is interested...    lots of upgrades and spare parts... lipo battery/charger/ landing gear/ training gear/ motors/ plastic blades/ main shafts/ tail rotors/ dual heat sinks on main and tail rotors and more...  not enough time/interest to get into it... it's never been higher then 3 feet...  PM me, i'll give ya a good deal...
gonna Pm ya
Is this a catholic thing
I have the Blade CX copter,twin rotor.Easy to learn on but cant fly upside down.Great for terrorizing chickens and goats. Joe
Uncle Buck (Goran) great bird got er in the air this morning ,flopped it over twice lol thanks for heli and nice meeting ya
Great meeting you too Darrell,  I hope you get more use out of it then i did...  practice makes perfect...

I was given a R-controlled "VAMP BAT" for Christmas and only had it airborne for about 7 minutes before a huge owl swooped down from nowhere grabbed it and flew away with my new toy in it's talons. I don't blame you if you don't believe me but its true and freaked me out totally.

Picked up a couple of those AirHog Heli's for my son this xmas, pretty cool.  I keep it interesting by chasing the cats with them and landing them on my ceiling fan.  But gonna pick this bad boy for my son, who is really getting into RC'n.  Starting him off with a Traxxas Stampede (electric).  Man, I can't believe how fast some of em go, 70+ mph, crazy.  But heres a pic of the one we are gonna get:

Electric is definitely the way to go in my opinion... clean and easy, useable indoors and no tuning required...  no performance difference interms of acrobatics or 3D flying in choppers when compared to nitro/gas units

HOOKED Ive got the Stampede brushless its crazy, I run the same batts I run on my EMAXX  and it moves great and lasts a very long time ,get your boy the emaxx I love mine 4 wd 2 speed tranny and fast and very durable ,ive also got a new Savage and its a great truck but finicky at times dammm nitro I like electric ,quite and fun

Hey 2 Tone Z71, is the EMAXX much more $ wise?  I know my son mentioned that one before.  BTW, where did you get yours?  My son found some sites where I was gonna order them from, not many hobby shops, or none that I could find, around my neck of the woods surprisingly.  Anyways, thanks for the heads up.

the trucks are both mid $350.00 range its the Batts and charger that adds up,get a good set of Batterys they last 15-20 min on a charge,The ONLY place I would buy from now is Ideal Hobby in Barrie ,ask for Gaven Or Andy ,Gaven is the owner and they ship Postal ,I use to deal with Hobby Hobby but there cust service sucks,you can go wrong with electric ,the Emaxx is 4wd takes 2 7.2 volt batts has 2 motors AWESOME machine,the Stampede 2wd takes 1 batt is brushless and set up with the expensive lipo batt and proper gearing will run 65 MPH,I had it out yesterday in the snow ice its very agile,the emaxx will go almost anywhere it will climb stairs in low gear,good luck and let me know what you end up getting,ill post some pics of the trucks in a few minutes
